summary:
Baghdad is Iraq's biggest city and capital, located on the Tigris River. With a rich history, it was once the world's largest city during the Islamic Golden Age. Founded in 762 AD, it was a cultural hub with great academic institutions. The city faced destruction by the Mongol Empire and later declined due to plagues and changing rule. It gained independence with Iraq in 1932. 

Modern Baghdad has faced challenges, including war damage and terrorism, but it remains a significant cultural center with historic mosques, museums, and palaces. It is also known as the "Gateway of Iraq" due to its airport.
title: Baghdad
